channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish put out just hours after saturday collection., 9th August
item.description:
Rubbish dumped EVERY day outside No. 13. Metal bread bin outside 19 and several bags of dog poo outside 17. This daily fly tipping problem is a real concern to the residents, is there a reason the Council are powerless to stop it? Please help. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Orsett Terrace, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rough drug taking sleepers living in tent, 9th August
item.description:
These rough sleepers have made a home within a tent in Gallions reach park west thamesmead. They are causing distress and alarm to the public by using a discreet part of the public park to live, defecate, take drugs, indulge in public indecency, littering etc. I have contacted Peabody who claim they are unable to help. I walk my dog within this park on a daily basis and I am intimidated by this happening.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hill View Drive, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight outside 406 lordship lane se22, 9th August
item.description:
Light not working. please fix as the road is very dark at night. At least 2 days
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 516, Lordship Lane, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes on Epsom Close DA7, 9th August
item.description:
Potholes have been here over a year and getting increasingly larger with traffic up and down the road Causes uneven road surface for vehicles which could incur damage and also dangerous for anyone crossing road as some are deep enough for a foot to fit into

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Epsom Close, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 9th August
item.description:
This car has been parked here for at least 3 weeks. Itâ€™s not a car that is usually parked in this road. Looking inside there are no personal effects in the car. There is also a key mark down the door, this I think has appeared since it has been parked here. It is parked on Crathie Road just up from the Eltham road end.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crathie Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy manhole cover on Camden Rd prevents sleep, 9th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camden Road, Kentish Town, London

item.title: Overgrown tree obscuring streetlight, 9th August
item.description:
Trees around the streetlight at the intersection of Milk Street and Autumn Grove have almost complete obscured the streetlight. This leaves the intersection as well as the unadapted section of Milk Street in darkness

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milk Street, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags and cardboard adjacent to commercial bins, 9th August
item.description:
This rubbish has been here for over a week on the street. I am not sure if it has been inadvertenty placed by the business or if it is from local people believing the business should process it, but the bins here attract this behaviour. If it was the business they should have containers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Rodney Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags, timber and toys strewn across the pavement with food waste adding to the mess and smell., 9th August
item.description:
This fly tip has been there for a few days now with no cleaning and the foxes are opening the bags to get at rotten food.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Litter and bird feathers, 9th August
item.description:
Now that part of the pavement has been blocked off by the building company, litter and feathers/ dirt from the pigeons roosting under the bridge are accumulating. Feathers are sticking to the mesh covering the fence. Should not the company keep that part of the pavement clean which is inaccessible due to their building fence? Would you ask them? (Unfortunately, no contact number is displayed).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128-136, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
